## Using `base::switch()`

You can often employ the use of `base::switch()` as an alternative to a long series of `if (...) {...} else if (...) {...} ...` statements:

```{r switch}
# Acceptable (not not ideal)
x_option <- function(x) {
  if (x == "a") {
    "option 1"
  } else if (x == "b") {
    "option 2" 
  } else if (x == "c") {
    "option 3"
  } else {
    stop("Invalid `x` value")
  }
}

# Optimal
x_option <- function(x) {
  switch(x,
    a = "option 1",
    b = "option 2",
    c = "option 3",
    stop("Invalid `x` value")
  )
}
```
